author: JOHN HEALY
title: Louisville coach Rick Pitino restrained after shouting at fan
text:
Louisville coach Rick Pitino restrained after shouting match with fan at halftime in game vs. North Carolina Louisville coach Rick Pitino restrained after shouting at fan   10:45 PM 
Rick Pitino looked like he was ready to throw down with a fan Wednesday night. 
The Louisville coach was walking back to the locker room at halftime in their game against North Carolina when he suddenly lost his cool and began shouting at a fan. 
What the fan said is unknown, but Pitino was irate and had to be restrained by several coaches. 
A Sports Illustrated reporter in attendance at the game also caught video which contains audio of the chaotic scene, though it is mostly inaudible. — Jonathan Jones (@jjones9) February 23, 2017 
It probably didn't help matters that No. 8 Louisville was trailing No. 7 UNC, 33-30, at the half. 
When Pitino returned for the start of the second half police officers were present in the area where the incident occurred, according to a reporter from the Courier-Journal. 
It’s been a rough week for college coaches. 
On Tuesday night, Kentucky head coach John Calipari walked away from an interview as Missouri fans taunted him. Louisville coach Rick Pitino loses his temper Wednesday night. (Streeter Lecka/Getty Images) 
Coaches here plenty of trash talk from fans every road game, but Pitino’s reaction suggests the possibility that a line may have been crossed. 
Or he just has really thin skin. Join the Conversation:
